body: ElementsAccessor::TransitionElementsKind and GrowCapacityAndConvert implementations are in objects/elements.cc. TransitionElementsKindImpl handles map-only transitions (no conversion) by calling JSObject::MigrateToMap or converts elements with ConvertElementsWithCapacity when switching between double/object, then JSObject::SetMapAndElements and updates allocation site. GrowCapacityAndConvertImpl computes new capacity, allocates a new backing store via ConvertElementsWithCapacity and sets map/elements similarly. Copy helpers include CopyObjectToObjectElements, CopyDoubleToObjectElements, CopySmiToDoubleElements, CopyObjectToDoubleElements and dictionary copies. These handle hole initialization and write barriers appropriately.
explanation: This RAG entry documents the C++ runtime that actually performs backing-store allocation, copying, conversion among SMI/DOUBLE/OBJECT, and sets map+elements. It's central to understanding what builtins call when they need to convert elements kinds or grow capacity.
